meanings.definition: To give wrong directions or instructions
meanings.sent1: She was misdirecting the lost tourists by pointing them in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent2: The prankster was misdirecting people to the wrong building as a joke.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was misdirecting the delivery person to the neighbor's house for fun.
meanings.sent4: The misleading signs were misdirecting drivers onto the closed road.
meanings.sent5: The faulty GPS was misdirecting hikers into the forest instead of the trail.

meanings.definition: To lead or guide in the wrong direction
meanings.sent1: The faulty map was misdirecting the hikers towards the dangerous cliff.
meanings.sent2: The deceptive sign was misdirecting drivers onto the detour route.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was misdirecting the dog away from its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The false trail marker was misdirecting the runners off the race course.
meanings.sent5: The confusing instructions were misdirecting the students during the exam.

meanings.definition: To divert or distract from the correct course or purpose
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was misdirecting the audience's attention from the main performance.
meanings.sent2: The bright lights were misdirecting the insects away from the garden plants.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected announcement was misdirecting the focus of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The tempting smell was misdirecting the dieter from sticking to their meal plan.
meanings.sent5: The interesting conversation was misdirecting the students from their homework assignment.
